member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.DatabaseNew.Register(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ConnectionProperties,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options)
member.summary: Registers a database.
member.remarks: Connects to a DatabaseNew and retrieves all schema information. The DatabaseNew object can then be saved to disk or used in a comparison. Progress feedback is provided via the Status event.
member.param: The connection properties associated with the database.
Options.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.DatabaseNew.Register(System.String,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromFolder.ScriptDatabaseInformation,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Registers the DatabaseNew from creation scripts that are stored in the folder specified by the path parameter.
member.param: The path to the folder that contains the creations scripts.

This is an optional parameter. If the specified folder contains the SQL Compare generated xml file with the necessary DatabaseNew information, it does not need to be specified. However, if the folder does not contain this information, or this information needs to be overriden, then this parameter must be set.
Options.
A list of files to use for the register if this is set to null then any .sql file found under the path and it's subfolders will be used

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IDatabase
member.summary: A SQL Server database object model. The object model may represent a scripts folder, snapshot, or a live database.

remarks.para: Use to register the Databasefrom a live server or to load a Database from a snapshot.
Registering a Database is a long-running operation. Status feedback is provided via the Status event handler. To cancel the operation, call CancelOperation.
You must call when you have finished using a Database object.

member.summary: Saves the database to disk.
member.param: The name of the snapshot file to be created.

member.summary: Writes the database snapshot to the specified stream. This is an alternative to the SaveToDisk method
member.param: The stream to write to.

member.summary: Loads the database from disk.
member.remarks: Progress events are fired via the Status event.

Whether the comparison is case sensitive (from the project options). This is checked against the case sensitivity of the snapshot to ensure that they match.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IDatabase.Register(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ConnectionProperties,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options)
member.summary: Registers a database.
member.remarks: Connects to a database and retrieves all schema information. The database object can then be saved to disk or used in a comparison. Progress feedback is provided via the Status event.
member.param: The connection properties associated with the database.
Options.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IDatabase.Register(System.String,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromFolder.ScriptDatabaseInformation,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options)
member.summary: Registers the database from creation scripts that are stored in the folder specified by the path parameter.
member.param: The path to the folder that contains the creations scripts.

This is an optional parameter. If the specified folder contains the SQL Compare generated xml file with the necessary database information, it does not need to be specified. However, if the folder does not contain this information, or this information needs to be overriden, then this parameter must be set.
Options.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IDatabase.Register(System.String,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromFolder.ScriptDatabaseInformation,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Registers the database from creation scripts that are stored in the folder specified by the path parameter.
member.param: The path to the folder that contains the creations scripts.

This is an optional parameter. If the specified folder contains the SQL Compare generated xml file with the necessary database information, it does not need to be specified. However, if the folder does not contain this information, or this information needs to be overriden, then this parameter must be set.
Options.
A list of files to use for the register if this is set to null then any .sql file found under the path and it's subfolders will be used

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IDatabase.CompareWith(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Database,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options)
member.summary: Compares the database with another database.
member.returns: A collection containing the differences between the two databases.

remarks.para: When two databases have been compared they can be synchronized using the class. Note that all objects that differ are selected for synchronization by default.
Progress feedback is provided via the Status event.

member.param: The database to compare with.
Comparison options.

member.summary: Creates a mapping for each object in the collection where such a mapping is possible. All of the iteration is performed here and the matching can be affected by changing in the sub class. The main action of joining to objects together is performed by which can itself call CreateMappings on child database objects.
member.param: List of objects in the first database, or null.
List of objects in the second database, or null.

Use the FullyQualifiedName for matching

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions
member.summary: Options used when comparing databases.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions.Default
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions.TrimTrailingSpaces
member.summary: If two columns of data differ only by the number of spaces at the end of the string, SQL Data Compare considers the data to be identical. The trailing spaces are not included in the synchronization script. This option does not apply to CLR or variant columns.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions.ForceBinaryCollation
member.summary: For all string data types, forces binary collation irrespective of column collation, resulting in a case-sensitive comparison. When this option is selected and the comparison key is a string, this may result in slower performance because the indexes are not used.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions.UseChecksumComparison
member.summary: When you are comparing tables or views with a large volume of data that changes infrequently, if you set this option, a checksum is used to compare the data. If the checksums differ, the data is compared; if the checksums are the same, the data is not compared. On SQL Server 2000 the connected user must be a member of the db_owner role or the system administrator role. This option applies only to SQL Server 2000 or later.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions.CompressTemporaryFiles
member.summary:
Compresses the temporary files that SQL Data Compare generates while performing the comparison. This reduces the possibility of running out of temporary disk space when comparing very large databases.
When you select this option, you will not be able to sort the results of the comparison.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ComparisonOptions.TreatEmptyStringAsNull
member.summary: Treat an empty string and null as equal for varchar, nvarchar

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions
member.summary: Options used when generating the mapping between two databases.

summary.para: The default options when generating the mappings. These are:

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.CaseSensitiveObjectDefinition
member.summary: Ignores the case of the object names (tables, views, users, roles, schemas, indexes, and columns) when mapping. For example, [dbo].[Widget] is considered to be the same as [dbo].[widget] when you select this option.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.IgnoreSpaces
member.summary: Ignores the spaces in the object names (tables, views, users, roles, schemas, indexes, and columns) when mapping. For example, [dbo].[Widget Prices] is considered to be the same as [dbo].[WidgetPrices] when you select this option.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.IgnoreUnderscores
member.summary: Ignores the underscores in the object names (tables, views, users, roles, schemas, indexes, and columns) when mapping. For example, [dbo].[Widget_Prices] is considered to be the same as [dbo].[WidgetPrices] when you select this option.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.MissingFrom2AsInclude
member.summary: When the object does not exist in the second database, the Mapping status is set to success and include is set to true.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.IncludeTimestamps
member.summary: Includes timestamp columns from the tables or views in the schema information for the database. Timestamp columns cannot be synchronized.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.IncludeIndexedViews
member.summary: Includes views in the schema information for the database. Views can be synchronized only if the referenced rows are from a single table, and the referenced columns are simple (for example, they must not include identity columns or computed columns).

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.IncludeIdentities
member.summary: Includes identity columns from the tables or views in the schema information for the database. You cannot synchronize views if they include an identity column.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.MappingOptions.MissingFrom1AsInclude
member.summary: This option is only used by SQL Source Control to get the diffs correct for conflicts in the ODP. If you start using this option elsewhere, please modify this text.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions
member.summary: Options used when synchronizing databases.

summary.para: The default options when synchronizing databases. These are:

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.DisableTriggers
member.summary: Disable, then re-enable, DML triggers on tables and views in the synchronization script.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.DisableKeys
member.summary: Disable, then re-enable, foreign keys in the synchronization script. Note that in some circumstances foreign keys are dropped and recreated rather than disabled and re-enabled.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.DropConstraintsAndIndexes
member.summary: Drop and recreate primary keys, indexes, and unique constraints in the synchronization script. If the primary key, index, or unique constraint is the comparison key, it cannot be dropped.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.OutputCommentHeader
member.summary: Include the comment header in the synchronization script. The comment header contains information about the databases that you are comparing, and the version of SQL Data Compare.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.DontUseTransactions
member.summary: Inserts BEGIN TRANSACTION at the beginning of the synchronization script and COMMIT TRANSACTION at the end of the synchronization script.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.TransportCLRBinary
member.summary: In the synchronization script, SQL Data Compare can use the binary representation or the string representation (.ToString()) of the CLR column. Setting this option forces SQL Data Compare to use the binary representation in the synchronization script. The binary representations of the CLR columns must be the same.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.DDLTriggerDisable
member.summary: Disable and then re-enable all DDL triggers in the synchronization script.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.DontOutputComments
member.summary: Include the comments in the output script. The comments make it easier to locate items in the output.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.ReseedIdentity
member.summary: Reseeds identity columns so that identity values in the database you are updating match values in the source database.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlOptions.ForceCheck
member.summary: Forces all disabled keys and constraints to be renabled with CHECK

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SynchronizationDirection
member.summary: The direction of migration for synchronization.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SynchronizationDirection.From1To2
member.summary: SQL scripts will migrate any changes in DataSource1 to DataSource2.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SynchronizationDirection.From2To1
member.summary: SQL scripts will migrate any changes in DataSource2 to DataSource1.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Database
member.summary:
This wrapper is to help us maintain the same public API.
Code should generally migrate to using IDatabase instead of this class. Where possible, the more specific interfaces (IDatabaseObjects, IComparable) should be used.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.FileTable
member.summary: Filetables are a new feature in 2012 that provide a filestream view of a folder/file hierarchy.
member.remarks:
They're basically just regular tables, except that all of the default schema is set in stone, while the user can add extra constraints, triggers and so on. We need to be able to compare the added stuff while making sure that the default stuff is not changed.
So we just pretend that the system-defined objects don't exist.
This is done by overriding the collections for these objects to filter out system-defined objects - note that this means that any operations that manipulate the object lists such as adding or sorting items must use eg the AllIndexes property instead. This only really affects DatabaseFactory/ReadFromFolder*
This might be improved by, instead of having two collections everywhere, making a collection which only enumerates the non-system-defined objects, but which will return system-defined ones if those are specifically requested (ie with this[] operator)
Filetables can also only be created using AS FILETABLE rather than constructing the default schema explicitely, so we need to take that into account if we try and rebuild one
I'm not sure if we need to worry about making sure the database is set up for filestream/filegroup stuff if we're deploying to a database that doesn't have those

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SearchPropertyList.ExtraScriptSources
member.summary: Since the property list can only be created with extra ALTER statements, we can have multiple script sources. ScriptSource always refers to the main CREATE statement and these refer to the ADD PROPERTY statements. When a scripts folder is modified, then all of these sources are blanked out and ScriptSource is replaced with the full SQL for the SPL to try and keep things tidy.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Migrations.MigrationsFolder.GetMigrationScripts(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Migrations.VersionInfo,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Migrations.VersionInfo)
member.summary: Return an enumerable collection of migration scripts where the migration script is entirely between fromVersion and toVersion, inclusive. Scripts should be in ascending or descending fromVersion order, depending on whether fromVersion < toVersion or toVersion < fromVersion respectively. If the script folder location for fromVersion and toVersion is not equal, then an empty list is returned, as cross-branch migrations are currently not supported. Migration scripts with locations other than found in fromVersion and toVersion are not returned, as they are not relevant.
member.param: The version from which to get migration scripts.
The version to which to get migration scripts.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Migrations.MigrationsFolder.GetMigrationScript(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a migration script matching the specified name, or null if there is no match.
member.param: The name of the migration script to return.

member.param: The version to match against fromVersion.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IWork.ScriptObject(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IDatabaseObject,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options)
member.summary: Returns the script necessary to create a SQL object.
member.remarks: This creates SQL code used to create an object such as a table, view, or stored procedure.

example.code:
Dim db As New Database()
db.Register(New ConnectionProperties(".", "WidgetStaging"), Options.Default)
Dim work As New Work()
'get the script for an object
Dim regions As Regions = work.ScriptObject(db.Tables(0), Options.Default)
Console.WriteLine("SQL script:") Console.WriteLine("{0}", regions.ToString())
'dispose db.Dispose()

member.returns: A Regions collection containing batches of SQL script.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.OldOptions
member.summary: This enum is used to record the old option values so that we can still parse old integer representations

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Option
member.summary: This enum is used to store the names of options and assign each of them a unique value
member.remarks: The duplication between this enum and the equivalent fields on is annoying. Alternatives include: - removing this list and using reflection on Options fields to reproduce it (pros: makes handling Default/Ssdt easier, cons: is a terrible terrible hack) - removing the fields on Options and changing everything to use a mix of Option and Options (pros: is probably the morally right thing to do, cons: means changing a whole lot of code and making it more complicated) Ideally we could get some sort of composite pattern going between Option and Options, but when one is a struct and the other is an enum that doesn't seem likely.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.BackupSystemTableSql2005
member.summary: The underlying system tables and lookup tables for SS2005. member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.BackupView
member.summary: The BackupView class is a simple object that just maps the view (an integer representing the view to the internal system) to its rela name. Its main purpose is to automatically trigger the loading of dependent views, tables etc. such that when a statement is executed against it all pre-requisities are in place.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.BackupViewTypesSql2005

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.SCSingleObjectQueryer
member.summary: A special implementation of the queryer interface for cases where there is only a single object going to be returned from the Query. (e.g. CaseCheck) In this case, this abstract class implements the Queryer's functions, the Enumerator's functions and the Enumerables functions. A deriving class need only provide an object of SCCTBBindableComponent and a TableDefinition to complete the implementation.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.SCCTBComponentQueryer
member.summary: The root class for Queryers - a queryer retrieves all the desired objects for a particular type. EG the Queryer for XMLSchemaCollection retrives all the XMLSchemaCollection objects within a particular database. Normally it will not be necessary to derive a class directly from SCCTBComponentQueryer but for maximum flexibility it is possible to.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.DatabaseHelperTypeMapper
member.summary: The purpose of this queryer is to handle variant data fields. Every variant has an associated intrinsic type that is stored in a parallel column created by the backup reader when it parses the system table. This parallel column is used to find out the true type of the variant for a particular cell so that variant's byte representation can be converted into a useful representation for presentation to the world.

member.throws: NotSupportedException if the integer does not represent a known view
member.returns: The SQLite compatiable CREATE View Script

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.SqlNameResolver.GetCollationForId(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Translates a CollationID into a string representation of the Collation
The collationID has 32 bits: (Each of the characters below represent 1 Bit)
SQL2000
HHHHHHHH-------PPPPPP----LLLLLL
SQL2005
HHHHHHHH-------PPPPPPP--LLLLLLL
where H are the High Bits - for special and compatiability collations P are the Property Bits - sets case sensitivity etc L are the Language Bits - sets the language of the collation. - Are uninteresting bits
if High bits not set
Then resulting collation ID is
Language_[prop_bits]
Prop Bits AND 1 = _BIN2 (SQL Server 2005) - other bits values don't matter Prop Bits AND 32 = _BIN - other bits values don't matter
The remaining prop bits read from right to left
P P P P Set _AI _CI Unset _WS _KS _AS _CS
If High Bits set
Return the collation string if special collation
Otherwise if High Bits has specific values 30-34 etc (See below)
Compatiability_[high_bits]_[lang_code]_[prop_code] - the steps to produce these values is show above
member.param: The collationID
member.returns: A string representation of the Collation or null if there is no representation.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.Sql2005NameResolver.PopulateAssemblyMetaData
member.summary:
Populate the Assembly Meta Data Table.
The binary representation of a clr assembly is loaded directly into the database and consists of a direct copy of the PE file. The live DB allows the retrieval of the full name of the assembly but this cannot be achieved without passing it through C# and calling the method FullName after loading the assembly.
This lookup table allows the retrieval of the assemblies full name through SQLite.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.Sql2005NameResolver.PopulateIDColsLookup
member.summary:
Populate the ID Cols Lookup Table
The identity, seed and last_value fields of syscolpars are stored as a binary value called idtval.
To break this value requires c#
Although the idtval can be a variable length of bytes (so far 13,25,61 bytes) have been observed the general pattern is that the low byte is a status code (value unknown) and the remaining n bytes divide into 3 equal portions with the first third (from left) the last_value, second third the increment and the third third the seed.

member.summary: Gets the real name of the view in the SQLite Database The actual value of this name is not guaranteed and this function should not be used to retrieve the name for external callers - instead the view should be retrieved through GetView which not only provides the name it also ensure dependent tables are loaded as well.

member.returns: The viewnname of will throw NotSupportedException if the argument doesn't represent a reocognised view.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.Sql2005NameResolver.PopulateSynonymsTable
member.summary:
Populate the Synonyms Lookup Table
The table needs to be populated with the object id of the object being referenced not just the name of the object. The name of the object is in the form of [db].[schema].[object_name]
If the object being referenced is in a different database the new row in the Synonyms table is set to null (the backups don't span multiple DB), otherwise the objects_id is looked up using the schema name and the object name.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.Sql2005NameResolver.PopulateUsersTable
member.summary:
Populate the Users Lookup Table.
This table was too complicated to be expressed directly in SQLite logic It is a C# implementation of the results of sp_helptext 'sys.users'

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.Sql2005NameResolver.GetSqlCmd(System.Int32)
member.summary:
This function returns the SQLite SQL representation of a SS2005 View.
All the views depends on system tables - either as a requirement or optionally to provide further textual information - this is denoted by the table name being in curly brackets ({})
Where a mask is used the numeric values are converted to decimal since it doesn't appear that SQLite supports hex values in form 0x
Furthermore all convert or sysconv function calls in the SS2005 text can be removed as SQLite is loosely typed and doesn't discriminate between the different integer / text types.
The source SS2005 SQL is included with an explanation of how the conversion to SQLite SQL was performed.
member.param: The view to retrive
member.throws: NotSupportedException if the view wasn't recognised.
member.returns: SQLite SQL

member.summary: Mapping success.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlCompareTableMapping
member.summary: Contains a mapping from a view or table to another view or table. Also contains information on the criteria used for matching the two tables, which can be based on an index or an arbitrary set of mapped fields.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlCompareTableMapping.#ctor(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ViewTableSuperClass,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ViewTableSuperClass,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlCompareTableMappingStatus,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor. Calls the base constructor and initializes the index mappings.
member.param: The view or table in the first database.
The view or table in the second database.
The status of the mapping.
Case sensitivity

summary.para: Checks the current contents of to determine whether the current TableMapping can be compared.

If the TableMapping can be compared, the TableMapping Status is set to Success; otherwise the Status is set to UnableToCompare. If not all of the fields in the table are mapped successfully, if the Status is not already set to UnableToCompare, it is set to PartialSuccess.

member.summary: Creates a shallow copy.

member.summary: The mapping was successful.

member.summary: The mapping succeeded, but SQL Data Compare is unable to compare. This is usually because of type comparison failure.

member.summary: The mapping was a partial success; some columns remain unmapped.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.DatabaseObjectResolver
member.summary: Resolver class for the AST parser.

Tries to resolve a schema object based on its name and owner. If the owner is not specified, it first tries to look at the owner hint. If this is not successful, it checks dbo as owner. If this does not help either, then we return null.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Dependencies
member.summary: The core object dependencies within a database.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Dependencies.SortByDependency(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Sorts the passed in items by dependency such that dependencies (children) come before items that depend on them (parents).
Note that this is equivalent to calling the other overload with a canIgnoreLinkToBreakCycle parameter that always returns false (i.e. links are never broken to fix circular dependencies).
member.param: The items to be sorted. If any elements are not present in the dependencies tree, they will be returned at the end of the returned list
member.returns: All the elements in 'items', sorted based on their inter-dependencies

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Dependencies.SortByDependency(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Sorts the passed in items by dependency such that dependencies (children) come before items that depend on them (parents). If any items have circular dependencies on each other, the 'canIgnoreLinkToBreakCycle' delegate will be given the opportunity to break links in order the break the circularity.
member.param: The items to be sorted. If any elements are not present in the dependencies tree, they will be returned at the end of the returned list

This delegate will be called for all links in a circular dependency chain between items. The first parameter is the parent id, and the second is the child id. The delegate should return true if that link can be ignored/broken when attempting to break the circularity.
member.returns: All the elements in 'items', sorted based on their inter-dependencies

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Dependencies.LogUnresolvableCycleAndFlatten(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Handles any circular dependencies that could not be resolved by breaking links. This implementation logs the circularity as a warning, and then simply returns the required elements in the order they are received - i.e. without attempting to resolve their inter-dependencies.
member.param: The nodes that need to be sorted
All of the elements that make up the circular chain (aka strongly connected component)
member.returns: 'sortRequired' unmodified.

member.summary: This field is for v5 UI to show what has been included implicitly. This is basically very similar to m_SelectedAsDependency, BUT it is NOT the same. Also, note that this is used before script generation in which m_SelectedAsDependency is used, thus it cannot be reset. Also, m_SelectedAsDependency is selecting more (for rebuilds), thus it cannot be used for the UI.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ExtendedProperties.ResetInternalKeysAfterParentRename
member.summary: ExtendedProperties are stored in the base class hashtable based on a key that contains the parent object (table, column!) name. However, if the parent object is to be renamed (see refactoring), then the hashtable needs to be repopulated. This method removes all entries from the hastable, and repopulates it with consideration to the new parent name. Note, that when this is executed, the parent name must already be set to its new value.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SchemaObjectMappings
member.summary: Holds mappings for tables or views in a schema.

example.code:
Option Explicit On
Imports RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine Imports RedGate.SQLDataCompare.Engine Imports RedGate.SQLDataCompare.Engine.ResultsStore
Public Class SchemaObjectMappingExample Sub RunExample() Dim session As New ComparisonSession
'register the databases for comparison Dim db1 As New Database Dim db2 As New Database
db1.RegisterForDataCompare(New ConnectionProperties(".", "WidgetDev")) db2.RegisterForDataCompare(New ConnectionProperties(".", "WidgetLive"))
Dim mappings As New SchemaObjectMappings
Dim SchemaObjectMapping As SchemaObjectMapping = mappings.Join(db1.Tables("[dbo].[WidgetPrices]"), db2.Tables("[dbo].[WidgetPrices]"))
' Set the custom comparison key for the table SchemaObjectMapping.MatchingMappings.Clear() SchemaObjectMapping.MatchingMappings.Add(SchemaObjectMapping.FieldMappings("WidgetID")) SchemaObjectMapping.RefreshMappingStatus()
' Set the where clause for the comparison SchemaObjectMapping.Where = New WhereClause("Active = 'Y'")
'compare the databases session.CompareDatabases(db1, db2, mappings)
Dim mapping As SchemaObjectMapping
Dim difference As TableDifference = session.TableDifferences("[dbo].[WidgetPrices]") Dim row As row For Each row In difference.ResultsStore 'loop through all the rows Dim field As FieldPair Dim i As Int32 = 0 Console.WriteLine("Row {0} type {1}", row.Index, row.Type.ToString()) For Each field In difference.ResultsStore.Fields 'work out where about in the results the field data is stored 'if we were comparing identical records, or records present in one 'database but not the other then we would not need to 'use the OrdinalInResults1 and OrdinalInResults2 properties 'but just OrdinalInResults Dim field1 As Int32 = field.OrdinalInResults1 Dim field2 As Int32 = field.OrdinalInResults2
If (field1 <> field2) Then 'get the values Dim value1 As Object = row.Values(field1) Dim value2 As Object = row.Values(field2) If (value1 Is Nothing) Then value1 = "NULL" End If If (value2 Is Nothing) Then value2 = "NULL" End If If row.FieldDifferent(i) Then Console.WriteLine("{0}:{1} <> {2}", field.Field(False).Name, value1.ToString(), value2.ToString()) Else Console.WriteLine("{0}:{1} == {2}", field.Field(False).Name, value1.ToString(), value2.ToString()) End If Else 'this is part of the unique index we are comparing on Dim value As Object = row.Values(field1) Console.WriteLine("*{0}:{1}", field.Field(False).Name, value.ToString()) End If i += 1 Next Next 'dispose of the objects session.Dispose() db1.Dispose() db2.Dispose() End Sub End Class

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_IDENTITY

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_IGNORE_UNDERSCORES
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Ignore underscores in object names.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_KEYS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Drop primary keys, indexes, and unique constraints.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_MISSING_FROM_ONE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For internal use only.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_RESEED_IDENTITY

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_SPACES
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Trim trailing spaces.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_SQL_COMMENTS

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_TIMES

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_TRANS

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_TRANSPORT_CLR_BINARY
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Transport CLR data types as binary.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_TRIGGERS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Disable DML triggers.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.NAME_VIEWS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Include views.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_BINARY
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For all string data types, forces binary collation irrespective of column collation, resulting in a case-sensitive comparison. When this option is selected and the comparison key is a string, this may result in slower performance because the indexes are not used..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_CASE
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Treats object names (tables, views, users, roles, schemas, indexes, and columns) as case sensitive when mapping. For example, [dbo].[Widget] willnot be mapped to [dbo].[wIDgEt] when this option is set.
Note that if the databases that you are comparing are running on a SQL Server that uses case-sensitive sort order, you should ensure that this option is selected..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_CHECKSUM
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Performs a checksum prior to comparison. The data is compared only if the checksums differ. On SQL Server 2000 db_owner permissions are required..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_COMMENTS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Include the comment header in the output script. The comment header contains information about the databases that you are comparing, and the version of SQL Data Compare..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_COMPRESSION
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Compresses the temporary files that SQL Data Compare generates while performing the comparison. This reduces the possibility of running out of temporary disk space when comparing very large databases.
When you select this option, you will not be able to sort the results of the comparison by clicking on a column header in the Row Differences pane..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_DDL_TRIGGER_DISABLE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Disables then re-enables DDL triggers in the synchronization SQL script..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A set of sensible defaults.

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_EMPTYSTRING_AS_NULL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For nvarchar and varchar fields the value null will be treated as being equal to an empty string..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_FORCECHECK
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Force all constraints disabled by Data Compare to be enabled after synchronization with CHECK..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_FOREIGN
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Disables then re-enables foreign keys in the synchronization SQL script. Note that in some circumstances foreign keys will be dropped and recreated rather than disabled and re-enabled..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_IDENTITY
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Includes identity columns in the comparison. You cannot synchronize a view if it includes an identity column..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_IGNORE_SPACES
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Ignores spaces in object names (tables, views, users, roles, schemas, indexes, and columns) when mapping. For example, [dbo].[Widget Prices] will be mapped to [dbo].[WidgetPrices]..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_IGNORE_UNDERSCORES
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Ignores underscores in the object names (tables, views, users, roles, schemas, indexes, and columns) when mapping. For example, [dbo].[Widget_Prices] will be mapped to [dbo].[WidgetPrices]..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_KEYS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Drops then recreates primary keys, indexes, and unique constraints in the synchronization SQL script. If the primary key, index, or unique constraint is the comparison key, it cannot be dropped..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_MISSING_FROM_ONE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For internal use only..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_MISSING_FROM_TWO
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For internal use only..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_RESEED_IDENTITY
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Reseeds identity columns so that identity values in the database you are updating match values in the source database..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_SPACES
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to If the data in two columns differs only by the number of spaces at the end of the string, SQL Data Compare considers the data to be identical. This option does not apply to CLR or XML columns.
Trailing spaces are ignored during synchronization, if this option is selected..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_SQL_COMMENTS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Do not include the comments in the output script. If the comments are present it makes it easier to locate items in the output..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_TIMES
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Includes timestamp columns in the comparison. Timestamp columns cannot be synchronized..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_TRANS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Does not use BEGIN TRANSACTION at the beginning of the synchronization SQL script or COMMIT TRANSACTION at the end of the synchronization SQL script..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_TRANSPORT_CLR_BINARY
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Uses the binary representation of CLR types in the synchronization SQL script. If this option is not selected SQL Data Compare uses the string representation..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_TRIGGERS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Disables then re-enables DML triggers on tables and views in the synchronization SQL script..

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.UIProject.DataCompareOptionsRes.TEXT_VIEWS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Includes views in the comparison. Views can be synchronized only if the referenced rows are from a single table, and the referenced columns are simple (for example, they must not include identity columns or computed columns)..

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ObjectTypeHelper
member.summary: Various useful methods for ObjectType

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options
member.summary: Options used when comparing and synchronizing databases.
member.remarks: Calling methods on default(Options) will throw an exception. Do not use default(Options). Instead, use a nullable version of the type.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.All
member.summary: For use in serialization etc.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.ForceColumnOrder
member.summary: Force table column order to be identical.
member.remarks: If additional columns are inserted into the middle of a table this option will force a rebuild of the table so the column order after synchronization is correct

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreFillFactor
member.summary: Ignore fill factor.
member.remarks: Ignores the fill factor in indexes when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnorePermissions
member.summary: Ignore permissions.
member.remarks: Ignores permissions on objects when comparing and synchronizing objects

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreWhiteSpace
member.summary: Ignore white space.
member.remarks: Ignores white space (newlines, tabs, spaces etc.) when comparing objects

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreBindings
member.summary: Ignore bindings.
member.remarks: Ignores bindings on columns and user defined types (eg sp_bindrule and sp_bindefault clauses won't be scripted)

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreQuotedIdentifiersAndAnsiNullSettings
member.summary: Ignore SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER and SET ANSI_NULLS statements.
member.remarks: Ignores these common SET statements when comparing views, stored procedures etc. Note that these statements will still appear in synchronization script. Note that all other Session SET statements are always ignored. It is not necessary to set this option for SSDT compatibility, it is part of the option group.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.CaseSensitiveObjectDefinition
member.summary: Treat items as case sensitive.
member.remarks: Treats object names such as ATable and atable as different, and carries out case sensitive comparisons on stored procedures etc.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreExtendedProperties
member.summary: Ignore extended properties
member.remarks: Ignores extended properties when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreFullTextIndexing
member.summary: Ignore full text indexing.
member.remarks: Ignores full text indexes, catalogs etc. when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.NoSQLPlumbing
member.summary: Do not include plumbing for transactional synchronization scripts.
member.remarks: Removes transactions from the synchronization scripts to produce more readable SQL

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreCollations
member.summary: Ignore collation order.
member.remarks: Ignores collation orders on character datatype columns when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreComments
member.summary: Ignore comments.
member.remarks: Ignores comments when comparing views, stored procedures etc. Note that comments will still appear in the synchronization scripts

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreIndexes
member.summary: Ignore indexes.
member.remarks: Ignores indexes, statistics, unique constraints and primary keys when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreKeys
member.summary: Ignore foreign keys.
member.remarks: Ignores foreign keys when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreChecks
member.summary: Ignore check constraints.
member.remarks: Ignores check constraints when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreTriggers
member.summary: Ignore DML triggers.
member.remarks: Ignores DML triggers when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IncludeDependencies
member.summary: Include dependencies.
member.remarks: Includes dependent objects when comparing and synchronizing databases. For example, if a view depends on a table then the table will be synchronized when synchronizing the view

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreInsteadOfTriggers
member.summary: Ignore INSTEAD OF triggers.
member.remarks: Ignores INSTEAD OF triggers when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreFileGroups
member.summary: Ignore filegroups, partition schemes, and partition functions.
member.remarks: Ignores FILEGROUP clauses when comparing and synchronizing databases

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreIdentitySeedAndIncrement
member.summary: Ignore identity seed and increment values.
member.remarks: Ignores identity seed and increment values when comparing databases. Note that they will still appear in synchronization scripts

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreWithNocheck
member.summary: Ignore WITH NOCHECK on foreign keys and check constraints.
member.remarks: Ignores disabled and not trusted flags on foreign keys. Ignores the 'not trusted' flag on foreign keys and check constraints. Note that if foreign keys or constraints are disabled then this will still be flagged.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreConstraintNames
member.summary: Ignore constraint names.
member.remarks: Ignores the names of foreign keys, indexes, primary keys, default, unique and check constraints when comparing.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreStatistics
member.summary: Ignore statistics.
member.remarks: Ignores statistics when comparing and synchronizing

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.DoNotOutputCommentHeader
member.summary: Do not output comment header.
member.remarks: Do not include the comment in the header of the output script

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.AddWithEncryption
member.summary: Add WITH ENCRYPTION option to stored procedures etc.
member.remarks: Add WITH ENCRYPTION option to stored procedures etc.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreSynonymDependencies
member.summary: Ignore dependencies through synonyms.
member.remarks: Ignore dependencies through synonyms.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.SeparateTriggers
member.summary: Separate triggers from tables and views.
member.remarks: Separate triggers from tables and views.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreOwners
member.summary: Ignore owners when checking for equality.
member.remarks: Ignore owners when checking for equality.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreQueueEventNotifications
member.summary: Ignore event notifications on queues.
member.remarks: Ignore event notifications on queues.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.TargetIsPre2005
member.summary: Flag target database as prior to SQL Server 2005. Internal use only.
member.remarks: Target database is pre SQL Server 2005.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.UseClrUdtToStringForClrMigration
member.summary: If a CLR assembly must be changed, unbind the dependent types from tables using ToString, and then convert these table values back to CLR type.
member.remarks: Target database is post SQL Server 2005.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.ConsiderNextFilegroupInPartitionSchemes

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.SsdtCompatibleOptions
member.summary: Make script folder output output compatible with SSDT.
member.remarks: IgnorePermissions is temporarily here until we've implemented support for SSDT style permissions IgnoreQuotedIdentifiersAndAnsiNullSettings is here because SET statements should not be part of an SSDT script and are stored separately. IgnoreWithNocheck is here because adding constraints with nocheck doesn't make sense as part of a DDL script - which has no data. IgnoreSystemNamedConstraintNames is here because sometimes SSDT style scripted objects don't have names, so when Compare generates a name internally it should continue to be ignored. InlineTableObjects is here because SSDT objects can't reference table objects created in ALTER statements (though the alter statements can be parsed). InlineFulltextFields is here for similar reasons to the above. InferTypeForSqlVariant is here because the trick Compare normally uses to tell SQL Server the actual type isn't supported in SSDT. UseSetStatementsInScriptDatabaseInfo is here because Set Statements can't be in scripts in SSDT. Eventually we'll probably just read this information from the sqlproj. WIP WriteAssembliesAsDlls - SSDT writes dlls by default WIP ForbidDuplicateIndexSettingsOnTable - some SSDT versions don't compile with duplicate table storage settings

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreInternallyUsedMicrosoftExtendedProperties
member.summary: Make scripting out of objects ignore the extended properties used internally by the SSMS designer
member.remarks: This option affects the scripting out of objects so that extended properties used internally by the SSMS designer (e.g. MS_DiagramPaneCount, MS_DiagramPane1, MS_DiagramPane2, MS_DiagramPane3, etc) are not included in the deployment script

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.InlineTableObjects
member.summary: Script out definitions as part of the table's body where possible for primary keys, foreign keys etc. Only some Indexes can be inlined.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.WriteAssembliesAsDlls
member.summary: WIP - CLR Assembly objects will be written in their true DLL form rather than our legacy sql script containing a binary blob in hex.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.InlineFulltextFields
member.summary: Script out FullText indexes as a single create instead of lots of ALTERs.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.ReadAsDataToolsPermissions
member.summary: WIP - Read in permissions from a script folder as though they were from a Data Tools project.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.WriteAsDataToolsPermissions
member.summary: WIP - Script out Permissions so they're correct as far as a Data Tools project is concerned.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.InferTypeForSqlVariant
member.summary: Allow SQL server to infer the type of a sql variant rather than trying to help it.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.UseSetStatementsInScriptDatabaseInfo
member.summary: Use RedGateDatabaseProperties.xml to store/recover set statements for objects.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.ForbidDuplicateTableStorageSettings
member.summary: To match SSDT behaviour, forbids setting filegroup, filestream, partition scheme, and data compression options on both a table and a clustered index or non-inlined clustered constraint on that table, event though when options are specified on both, the options specified on the table are ignored by SQL Server.
member.remarks: See http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/ssdt/thread/c5c8802f-c6d1-4986-9768-c5f7340bda34/

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options.IgnoreWithEncryption
member.summary: Ignore WITH ENCRYPTION statements on triggers, views, stored procedures and functions

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ParserHelper.TextEqualWithExtraParantheses(System.String,System.String,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options)
member.summary: This is based on TextEqual but sort of ignores parantheses. Anything can be surrounded by any number of matching parantheses, as long as this does not affect evaluation order. This method builds up the expression trees for the input defaults and constraints, and does a comparison at the tree level. Comments and whitespaces are ignored to support future extensions, but note the SS does not allow comments in defaults/constraints, neither does it allow arbitrary whitespaces. (SS also has a go at parantheses, and SqlServer2005 goes bererk with them anyway.)

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.SCKeyInfo
member.summary: Equivalent to SQL Server CKeyInfo struct. Not all fields are populated at the moment - if they aren't required, I've omitted them to speed things up a bit.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.SCUserPopulator
member.summary:
All of the Simple Population Functions implement ISCSimplePopulator which only requires a string form of the SQL to be executed and a TableDefinition object that defines the mapping between external name (that which be accessed from the Population Engine of SQL Compare) and the internal name that is used to represent the data being retrieved from the SQL Statement being returned from the implementation of the "Sql" poperty. In most cases the internal and external names will be identical but when there is a translation that has to be done (for example coalescing two results into a single result) the TableDefinition will be furnised with information on how to perform such work. A user defined function pointer can be supplied to do any work more complicated than this. The TableDefinition object also specifies the type of data that will be returned and its datasize (although SQLite doesn't enforce data width constraints)
The Sql Property will, by reference to the backupViews .GetView function cause the loading of all views/system tables that it depends on.
All of the implementation's sql is as near as possible identical to the SQL used by the live DB - the only modifications that have been made are to remove syntax that isn't supported by SQL Lite (e.g. system functions) and re-express it. In the examples where there is an undocumented system function I have tried to observe its behaviour to work out what data it is dependent upon.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.ReadFromBackup.SC2000UserPopulator
member.summary:
All of the Simple Population Functions implement ISCSimplePopulator which only requires a string form of the SQL to be executed and a TableDefinition object that defines the mapping between external name (that which be accessed from the Population Engine of SQL Compare) and the internal name that is used to represent the data being retrieved from the SQL Statement being returned from the implementation of the "Sql" poperty. In most cases the internal and external names will be identical but when there is a translation that has to be done (for example coalescing two results into a single result) the TableDefinition will be furnised with information on how to perform such work. A user defined function pointer can be supplied to do any work more complicated than this. The TableDefinition object also specifies the type of data that will be returned and its datasize (although SQLite doesn't enforce data width constraints)
The Sql Property will, by reference to the backupViews .GetView function cause the loading of all views/system tables that it depends on.
All of the implementation's sql is as near as possible identical to the SQL used by the live DB - the only modifications that have been made are to remove syntax that isn't supported by SQL Lite (e.g. system functions) and re-express it. In the examples where there is an undocumented system function I have tried to observe its behaviour to work out what data it is dependent upon.

member.summary: Handle the triggers in the case of a table split. Not that this also handles the extended properties on triggers. There is no need to drop a trigger if all the original table columns remain. If a trigger also does not look at the inserted and deleted virtual tables chances are good that it is harmless, so we keep it.
member.param: Extra warnings.

member.summary: Constructs a SQLSetOptions class. This stores information about connection settings, such as ANSI warnings, ANSI NULLs, quoted identifiers, etc.

member.summary: Constructs a SQLSetOptions class. This stores information about connection settings, such as ANSI warnings, ANSI NULLs, quoted identifiers, etc.
member.param: Sets the force attribut to include both positive and negative set options.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlSetOptions.SetOption(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SQLScriptBuilder,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets an option.
member.param: The block writer in which the option setting should be scripted to.
The name of the setting. This could be NSI_PADDING, ANSI_WARNINGS, CONCAT_NULL_YIELDS_NULL, ARITHABORT, QUOTED_IDENTIFIER, ANSI_NULLS, or NUMERIC_ROUNDABORT.
The value of the setting. This can be true or false.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SqlSetOptions.SetDefaultOptions(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SQLScriptBuilder)
member.summary: Sets the default options. This sets numeric roundabort to false, ANSI padding to true, ANSI warnings to true, concatenation yields NULL to true, arithmetic abort to true, quoted identifiers to true, and ANSI NULLs to true.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.SyncToScript.ForeignKeyNoOpFilter
member.summary: Since a FK on table2 referenced a field in table1, for a live database changing table1 requires a table2 rebuild This is obviously not the case for a scripts folder where a drop and recreate is a NoOp This class provides a view over Foreign Keys that filters out such NoOps for use in script folder modifications.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1
member.summary:
Uses Tarjan's strongly connected components algorithm (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarjan's_strongly_connected_components_algorithm) to perform a (reverse) topological sort of a graph of nodes, while dealing intelligently with the presence of cycles.
Once the TopologicalSort has been constructed for a graph, the DepthFirstOrder() methods can be called to sort a set of nodes based on the topological ordering of the graph. Any nodes in the set that are present in the topological ordering will be returned such that child nodes come before their parents (i.e. in dependency order), while any nodes that are not present in the topological ordering will be returned at the end of the sorted list. If more than one node from a single strongly connected component (cycle) needs to be sorted, a CycleResolutionStrategy can be used to break the cycle and provide a suitable ordering.
member.typeparam: The type of nodes within the graph

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.m_Vertices
member.summary: Mapping from vertices in the graph to the additional data required by Tarjan's algorithm

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.m_Edges
member.summary: Delegate that defines the edges present in the graph (a mapping from a Vertex to its children)

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.m_Cycles
member.summary: Mapping from component id to list of elements in that component, where the component has more than one element.

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.m_Index
member.summary: Used while traversing the tree to build up the set of strongly connected components

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.m_ComponentCount
member.summary: total number of separate strongly connected components encountered

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Func{`0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0}})
member.summary: Creates a (reverse) topological ordering for a graph of nodes (vertices defined by the 'nodes' argument, and edges by the 'children' argument) that can then be used to sort a subset of those nodes into dependency order.
member.param: All of the vertices in the graph to be searched
Delegate that provides the children for a given vertex

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.GetComponentIndex(`0)
member.summary: Obtain the depth-first post-order index of the given node (children have lower indices than their parents. If node is not one of the nodes in the graph, it is given an index of Int32.MaxValue - i.e. it comes after all nodes that are in the graph.
member.param: The node whose relative ordering in the graph is required
member.returns: The index into the ordering, such that a descendant node has a lower index than its ancestor nodes.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.DepthFirstOrder(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary:
Sorts a set of nodes by their position in the topological sort of the graph, such that all child nodes are returned before their ancestors. Any nodes in 'unsorted' which are not part of the graph are returned at the end of the list in an undefined order. If cycles (circular dependencies) are encountered while sorting the nodes, a CycleDetected exception is thrown.
This is equivalent to calling DepthFirstOrder(unsorted, ThrowOnCycle)
member.param: The elements to be returned in sorted order
member.returns: The members of 'unsorted', ordered by their position in the depth first ordering of the graph, such that all child nodes come before their ancestors.
member.exception: if any cycles are encountered while attempting to sort

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.DepthFirstOrder(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort{`0}.CycleResolutionStrategy)
member.summary: Sorts a set of nodes by their position in the topological sort of the graph, such that all child nodes are returned before their ancestors. Any nodes in 'unsorted' which are not part of the graph are returned at the end of the list in an undefined order. If multiple nodes from a single strongly connected component (cycle/circular dependency) are in the unsorted list, 'cycleHandler' is used to provide a full ordering for those nodes.
member.param: The elements to be returned in sorted order
Used to provide an ordering for nodes in unsorted which come from the same strongly connected component.
member.returns: The members of 'unsorted', ordered by their position in the depth first ordering of the graph, such that all child nodes come before their ancestors.
member.exception: if any cycles are encountered while attempting to sort

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.ThrowOnCycle
member.summary: This CycleResolutionStrategy throws an exception if multiple nodes from a cycle are required.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.AttemptToBreakLinks(System.Func{`0,`0,System.Boolean},RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort{`0}.CycleResolutionStrategy)
member.summary: Obtains a CycleResolutionStrategy that will attempt to sort the required nodes by breaking links in the strongly connected component.
member.param: Callback which will be used to indicate whether a particular link can be broken when attempting to break a cycle. The first argument is the parent node, and the second is the child node. This delegate should return true if the given link can be broken (i.e. if it can be considered a 'weak link')
Used to deal with any cycles that cannot be broken by breaking the links indicated by breakableLink
member.returns: The necessary CycleResolutionStrategy

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.StrongConnect(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort{`0}.TarjanVertex,System.Collections.Generic.Stack{RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort{`0}.TarjanVertex})
member.summary: Recursive function used to perform depth-first search for Tarjan's algorithm.
member.param: The current vertex being considered
Stack of vertices in the current recursion

member.name: P:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.Cycles
member.summary: The set of cycles (circular dependencies) found in the graph - i.e. all of the strongly connected components where the number of elements within the component is greater than one.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.CycleResolutionStrategy
member.summary: This delegate is used to provide an ordering for nodes which form part of the same strongly connected component (cycle/circular dependency).
member.param: The nodes which need to be sorted
The full set of nodes that make up the strongly connected component that requiredNodes belong to
member.returns: The order in which requiredNodes should be returned to the caller

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.TarjanVertex
member.summary: Data associated with each vertex for Tarjan's algorithm

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.TarjanVertex.ComponentIndex
member.summary: The index of the strongly connected component this vertex belongs to

member.name: F:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.TopologicalSort`1.TarjanVertex.InStack
member.summary: Ensure that checking whether item is in the stack is an O(1) operation by setting this flag when this vertex is pushed on to the stack, and clearing it when it is popped.

Unbinding user defined data types.
We might need to drop user defined types later on, for later modification. Before we can do this, we need to unbind them from any tables
Note that columns cannot be altered if ROWGUIDCOLs are bound to them

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Triggers.ResetInternalKeysAfterParentRename
member.summary: Triggers are stored in the base class hashtable based on a key that contains the parent table name. However, if the table is to be renamed (see refactoring), then the hashtable needs to be repopulated. This method removes all entries from the hastable, and repopulates it with consideration to the new table name. Note, that when this is executed, the table name must already be set to its new value.

member.name: T:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Work
member.summary: Used to calculate the work to be done to synchronize databases.
member.remarks:
The Work class is used to convert a set of into an containing SQL script, which can be used to synchronize two databases. It also provides and about the work to be done.
can be used to generate scripts for individual database objects.
Note that you should not re-use a Work object; you should re-create a new object every time.

member.param: The differences to use.
The synchronization options.
True if the SQL script is to be run on the second database.

member.name: M:RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Work.ScriptObject(RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.IDatabaseObject,RedGate.SQLCompare.Engine.Options)
member.summary: Returns the script necessary to create a SQL object.
member.remarks: This creates SQL code used to create an object such as a table, view, or stored procedure.

example.code:
Dim db As New Database()
db.Register(New ConnectionProperties(".", "WidgetStaging"), Options.Default)
Dim work As New Work()
'get the script for an object
Dim regions As Regions = work.ScriptObject(db.Tables(0), Options.Default)
Console.WriteLine("SQL script:") Console.WriteLine("{0}", regions.ToString())
'dispose db.Dispose()

member.returns: A Regions collection containing batches of SQL script.
